# The `LLVMContext` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

This is an important class for using LLVM in a threaded context. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Declaration

<CodeBlock>class llvm::LLVMContext</CodeBlock>

## Description {#details}

This is an important class for using LLVM in a threaded context.

It (opaquely) owns and manages the core &quot;global&quot; data of LLVM&#39;s core infrastructure, including the type and constant uniquing tables. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/llvmcontext">LLVMContext</a> itself provides no locking guarantees, so you should be careful to have one context per thread.

Definition at line 67 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/llvmcontext-h">LLVMContext.h</a>.

### diagnose() {#aad03ef5cfbe6e7cad076d9e45ba06592}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void LLVMContext::diagnose (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/diagnosticinfo">DiagnosticInfo</a> &amp; DI)</>}>
Report a message to the currently installed diagnostic handler.

This function returns, in particular in the case of error reporting (DI.Severity == <em>DS&#95;Error</em>), so the caller should leave the compilation process in a self-consistent state, even though the generated code need not be correct.

The diagnostic message will be implicitly prefixed with a severity keyword according to <code>DI.getSeverity()</code>, i.e., &quot;error: &quot; for <em>DS&#95;Error</em>, &quot;warning: &quot; for <em>DS&#95;Warning</em>, and &quot;note: &quot; for <em>DS&#95;Note</em>.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/llvmcontext-h/#l00275">275</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/llvmcontext-h">LLVMContext.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/llvmcontext-cpp/#l00245">245</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/llvmcontext-cpp">LLVMContext.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### emitError() {#a4447dfc5ac5a8784a0a933a5be56bbf5}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void LLVMContext::emitError (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42; I, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine">Twine</a> &amp; ErrorStr)</>}>
emitError - Emit an error message to the currently installed error handler with optional location information.

This function returns, so code should be prepared to drop the erroneous construct on the floor and &quot;not crash&quot;. The generated code need not be correct. The error message will be implicitly prefixed with &quot;error: &quot; and should not end with a &quot;.&quot;.

### getDefaultTargetCPU() {#ac597b14eb5cde4587d18c61a0b23c850}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="StringRef LLVMContext::getDefaultTargetCPU ()">
Get or set the current &quot;default&quot; target CPU (target-cpu function attribute).

The intent is that compiler frontends will set this to a value that reflects the attribute that a function would get &quot;by default&quot; without any specific function attributes, and compiler passes will attach the attribute to newly created functions that are not associated with a particular function, such as global initializers. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function/#a5dfae571c803bc1e2cd79bf98cc1951f">Function::createWithDefaultAttr()</a> will create functions with this attribute. This function should only be called by passes that run at compile time and not by the backend or LTO passes.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/llvmcontext-h/#l00331">331</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/llvmcontext-h">LLVMContext.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/llvmcontext-cpp/#l00365">365</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/llvmcontext-cpp">LLVMContext.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getDiagnosticsHotnessThreshold() {#aded771687bdc915d3b992cbbee8c22c7}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>uint64&#95;t LLVMContext::getDiagnosticsHotnessThreshold () const</>}>
Return the minimum hotness value a diagnostic would need in order to be included in optimization diagnostics.

Three possible return values: 0 - threshold is disabled. Everything will be printed out. positive int - threshold is set. UINT64&#95;MAX - threshold is not yet set, and needs to be synced from profile summary. Note that in case of missing profile summary, threshold will be kept at &quot;MAX&quot;, effectively suppresses all remarks output.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/llvmcontext-h/#l00230">230</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/llvmcontext-h">LLVMContext.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/llvmcontext-cpp/#l00149">149</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/llvmcontext-cpp">LLVMContext.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getMainRemarkStreamer() {#a19d22ad9c5c31e15059a4eb4b347629c}

<MemberDefinition

The &quot;main remark streamer&quot; used by all the specialized remark streamers.

This streamer keeps generic remark metadata in memory throughout the life of the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/llvmcontext">LLVMContext</a>. This metadata may be emitted in a section in object files depending on the format requirements.

### setYieldCallback() {#a26b9a4decea0c52a7225bc63c8166f90}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void LLVMContext::setYieldCallback (<a href="#a8671da9544d8cfdf4ccc798e560bdccc">YieldCallbackTy</a> Callback, void &#42; OpaqueHandle)</>}>
Registers a yield callback with the given context.

The yield callback function may be called by LLVM to transfer control back to the client that invoked the LLVM compilation. This can be used to yield control of the thread, or perform periodic work needed by the client. There is no guaranteed frequency at which callbacks must occur; in fact, the client is not guaranteed to ever receive this callback. It is at the sole discretion of LLVM to do so and only if it can guarantee that suspending the thread won&#39;t block any forward progress in other LLVM contexts in the same process.

At a suspend point, the state of the current LLVM context is intentionally undefined. No assumptions about it can or should be made. Only LLVM context API calls that explicitly state that they can be used during a yield callback are allowed to be used. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/any">Any</a> other API calls into the context are not supported until the yield callback function returns control to LLVM. Other LLVM contexts are unaffected by this restriction.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/llvmcontext-h/#l00294">294</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/llvmcontext-h">LLVMContext.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/llvmcontext-cpp/#l00195">195</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/llvmcontext-cpp">LLVMContext.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### shouldDiscardValueNames() {#a865b245ad9c5dc10922481c736ed4a4a}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="bool LLVMContext::shouldDiscardValueNames () const">
Return true if the Context runtime configuration is set to discard all value names.

When true, only <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/globalvalue">GlobalValue</a> names will be available in the IR.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/llvmcontext-h/#l00149">149</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/llvmcontext-h">LLVMContext.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/llvmcontext-cpp/#l00330">330</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/llvmcontext-cpp">LLVMContext.cpp</a>.

### yield() {#a547073a4bb4e2577f0bcee9a2173d349}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void LLVMContext::yield ()">
Calls the yield callback (if applicable).

This transfers control of the current thread back to the client, which may suspend the current thread. Only call this method when LLVM doesn&#39;t hold any global mutex or cannot block the execution in another LLVM context.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/llvmcontext-h/#l00301">301</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/llvmcontext-h">LLVMContext.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/llvmcontext-cpp/#l00201">201</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/llvmcontext-cpp">LLVMContext.cpp</a>.
